meanings.definition: Capable of being demoted or moved to a lower position.
meanings.sent1: The employee knew that if he made a mistake, he was relegable to a lower job.
meanings.sent2: In the military, soldiers who disobey orders are often considered relegable to a lower rank.
meanings.sent3: After spilling coffee on his boss, he joked that he might become relegable to the janitorial staff.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of promotion seemed relegable after the company's financial losses.
meanings.sent5: The fragile alliance between the two countries was relegable to collapse at any moment.

meanings.definition: Able to be assigned to a lower status or rank.
meanings.sent1: The rookie player was nervous about being relegable to the bench during the important game.
meanings.sent2: During tough times, even the most experienced employees can be relegable to entry-level positions.
meanings.sent3: The cat, feeling lazy, pretended to be relegable to the role of a pampered pet.
meanings.sent4: The once prestigious award now seemed relegable to a mere participation certificate.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was relegable to collapse under the weight of the heavy trucks.
